statement.tex: \text{A factory makes tennis rackets and cricket}\\ \text{bats. A tennis racket takes 1.5 hours of}\\ \text{machine time and 3 hours of a craftman's}\\ \text{time in its making, while a cricket bat takes}\\ \text{3 hours of machine time and 1 hour of a}\\ \text{craftman's time to make it. In a day, the}\\ \text{factory has the availability of not more than}\\ \text{42 hours of machine time and 24 hours of a}\\ \text{craftsman's time.}\\ \text{(i) What number of rackets and bats must be}\\ \text{made if the factory is to work at full capacity?}\\ \text{(ii) If the profit on a racket and on a bat is}\\ \text{Rs.20 and Rs.10 respectively, find the}\\ \text{maximum profit of the factory.}

step.context: \text{If the factory produces x rackets and y bats in}\\ \text{a day, are these the functions to maximise?}
step.tex: \text{(i) Capacity = C(x, y)}\\ \begin{align} C &= x(unit)+y(unit) \\ &= x+y\\ \end{align}\\ \text{(ii) Profit = P(x, y)}\\ \begin{align} P &= x(unit)\cdot 20\left(\dfrac{Rs}{unit}\right)+ y(unit)\cdot 10\left(\dfrac{Rs}{unit}\right) \\ &= 20x+10y \end{align}

\text{Machine time limitation}\\ \begin{align} \implies &x\cdot 1.5(hrs)+y\cdot 3(hrs) \le 42(hrs) \\ \implies &1.5x + 3y\le 42 \implies x/2 + y\le 14 \end{align}\\ \text{Craftsmen time limitation}\\ \begin{align} \implies &x\cdot 3(hrs)+y\cdot 1(hrs) \le 24(hrs)\\ \implies &3x+y\le 24 \end{align}\\ \text{Number of items produces cannot be negative,}\\ \implies x\ge 0,\, y\ge 0

\text{Machine time limitation}\\ \begin{align} \implies y\cdot 3(hrs) \le 42(hrs) \\ \implies 3y\le 42 \implies y\le 14 \end{align}\\ \text{Craftsmen time limitation}\\ \begin{align} \implies &x\cdot 3(hrs) \le 24(hrs)\\ \implies &3x\le 24\implies x\le 8 \end{align}\\ \text{Number of items produces cannot be negative,}\\ \implies x\ge 0,\, y\ge 0
step.reason: \text{Each type of product (racket or bat) requires}\\ \text{both machine and human time.}

step.context: \text{Can we predict }\\ \text{(i) the full capacity of the factory, and}\\ \text{(ii) it's maximum profitability }\\ \text{based on corner points in the diagram above?}
step.tex: \begin{array}{ccc} \text{Corner Point} &C=x+y & P=20x + 10y\\ (0, 14) &14 &140 \\ (0, 0) &0 &0 \\ (8, 0) &8 &160 \\ (4, 12) &16 &200 \\ \end{array}\\ \text{Both functions are maximum at (4, 12).}
